forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog before 1am. Mostly clear, with a low around 47. North wind 1 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 58 in the afternoon. North wind 16 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 38 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn approaches in Downtown San Francisco, a veil of patchy fog lingers, slowly receding from its embrace of the night. While the air remains crisp, a gentle north wind whistles its way through the streets, sending shivers beneath the layers of evening wear. Currently resting at a cool 47 degrees, the city is poised for a transition as the sun mounts in the sky, promising a bright day with temperatures rising to about 62 degrees before softly sliding back to 58 in the afternoon. As the fog dissipates, the horizon will reveal the golden outlines of the Golden Gate Bridge, a visual serenade against the backdrop of this urban landscape.

In preparation for the day ahead, it would be wise to don a light jacket, perhaps even a cozy scarf, to ward off the post-dawn chill. The robust winds, gusting up to 38 mph, add a bite that lingers in the air. A leisurely stroll through the Presidio or a visit to one of the city’s many cozy cafes could serve as perfect passages for the day, all while experiencing the gradual warming and clarity that the sun brings. The hustle of Saturday beckons, with opportunities both mundane and wonderful awaiting those who wish to savor the day.
